description: Australia’s military is loosening recruitment criteria to enable non-citizens to join its ranks and help address a personnel shortfall in the defense forces.
title: Australia’s Military to Recruit Foreigners as Shortfall Deepens

description: Claudia Sheinbaum had mere hours to enjoy the victory that will make her Mexico’s first female president before her northern neighbor reminded her how difficult the new gig will be.
title: Biden, US-Mexico Border Crisis Loom Large in Sheinbaum’s Early Hours

description: The Confederation of British Industry is urging the next UK government to ease trading frictions to help spur growth, throwing a spotlight on post-Brexit ties with the European Union.
title: Business Urges Next UK Government to Cut Brexit Trade Friction

description: Arguments on Donald Trump’s appeal to remove Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis from the Georgia election-interference case have been tentatively set for Oct. 4, making a trial before the US presidential election on Nov. 5 virtually impossible.
title: Trump’s Georgia Appeal Set for Oct. 4, Dooming Pre-Election Trial

description: New Jersey Democrat Bob Menendez filed to run for reelection as an independent on Monday, a move that could be costly for Democrats trying to hold on to what has been a safe Senate seat.
title: Bob Menendez Files to Run as Independent for Senate While on Trial

description: On Voternomics, White House national security adviser for economics Daleep Singh explains how America is seeking to maintain global influence.
title: US Battles for ‘Hearts and Minds’ in a Conflicted World

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, politics reporter Gregory Korte outlines how the US electorate has changed since the 2020 election. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Election 2024 Features Same Candidates But a New Cast of Voters

description: TikTok’s parent company, ByteDance Ltd., has appointed former Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. executive John Rogovin as new global general counsel.
title: TikTok Parent Hires New General Counsel as App Fights US Government

description: Donald Trump and the Republican National Committee raised $141 million in May, according to his campaign, a fundraising total boosted by a surge in contributions after a New York jury found him guilty in a criminal trial involving hush-money charges.
title: Trump Rakes in $141 Million in May, Aided by Guilty Verdict

description: Nigel Farage’s critics call him a “shameless opportunist.” On Monday, the Brexit architect picked the perfect moment to deal Rishi Sunak a gut punch — the day before the first TV debate of the UK election campaign and just as a major poll put the prime minister’s ruling Conservatives on track for a historic rout.
title: Nigel Farage Barrels Into UK Campaign as Sunak Faces First Debate Against Starmer

description: Sudan’s deputy leader is traveling to Russia for talks, days after the North African nation’s army said it may get weapons in exchange for letting the Kremlin establish a military fueling station on the Red Sea coast.
title: Sudan’s Deputy Visits Russia With Weapons-for-Port Deal on Table

description: President Joe Biden will sign an executive order on Tuesday allowing him to halt some asylum claims at the US-Mexico border, seeking to curb migrant crossings and address one of his biggest liabilities in the election campaign against Donald Trump.
title: Biden to Crack Down on Migrants by Slashing Asylum Claims

description: Rising uncertainty around the US election could endanger some of this year’s most popular macro trades as investors rush to cut exposures, according to Morgan Stanley.
title: Morgan Stanley Warns US Elections Threaten Popular Macro Trades

description: Mexican President-Elect Claudia Sheinbaum’s coalition got very close to clinching a supermajority in congress, obtaining two-thirds of the seats in the lower house and nearly two-thirds in the senate.
title: Sheinbaum Allies Narrowly Miss Supermajority in Mexico Congress

description: Portugal’s government plans to tighten immigration rules by requiring a work visa from most foreigners wishing to enter and live in the country.
title: Portugal to Tighten Visa Rules in Response to Record Immigration

description: Rishi Sunak is considering hardening his Conservative Party’s position on the European Convention on Human Rights, as disastrous polling and Brexit architect Nigel Farage’s decision to stand for Reform UK in the general election leave the premier’s ruling party facing a potential wipe out.
title: Sunak Mulls Move on ECHR as Farage Plunges UK Tories Into Crisis

description: Norway’s chief of defense said the NATO alliance has a window of two to three years to prepare before Russia has rebuilt the ability to carry out a conventional attack.
title: Norway Military Chief Sees Short Window to Boost NATO’s Defenses

description: South Africa’s African National Congress suffered a historic rebuke in last week’s elections, losing its parliamentary majority for the first time since it took power when apartheid ended in 1994. Now, with just 40.2% of the vote, it’s forced to seek out an alliance or coalition — likely with its biggest political rival. The horse trading has just begun.
title: South Africa’s ANC Has to Navigate Minefield to Retain Power

description: Former Brazil Finance Minister Guido Mantega said President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s government sought him for a spot on the board of Braskem SA, and he will accept the job if shareholders approve.
title: Former Brazil Finance Head Says Lula’s Government Contacted Him for Braskem Job

description: Keir Starmer’s Labour Party is heading for a landslide victory in the UK election with a parliamentary majority of 194 seats, according to modeling by pollster YouGov.
title: Labour on Track for Historic UK Majority, YouGov Model Shows

description: The Czech Republic appears to be on track to keep its full-year budget deficit within the approved limit of 252 billion koruna ($11.1 billion), according to Finance Minister Zbynek Stanjura.
title: Czech Minister Sees Deficit on Track to Meet $11 Billion Target

description: The outgoing leader used rambling, hours-long daily briefings to set the agenda and forge connections with ordinary folks. Replicating their success may be President-elect Claudia Sheinbaum’s toughest task.
title: The End of AMLO’s Presidency Will Leave a Void in Mexico’s Morning

description: Vice President Kamala Harris will represent the US at the Ukraine summit in Switzerland later this month, confirming President Joe Biden’s plan to skip the gathering.
title: Harris to Attend Ukraine Summit With Biden Booked for Fundraiser

description: Brexit architect Nigel Farage said he’ll stand as a candidate for Reform UK in Britain’s July 4 general election, a U-turn that threatens to further undermine Rishi Sunak’s bid to keep his Conservatives in power.
title: Nigel Farage Barrels Into UK Election, Raising Risk of Tory Rout

description: US President Joe Biden’s proposal for a cease-fire and hostage-release deal to end the war in Gaza was only part of the full package, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said.
title: Israel Says Biden’s Latest Gaza Peace Plan Is Only Part of Story

description: A pledge by Britain’s Labour opposition to build 1.5 million homes in five years would be a “Herculean task” and “very difficult” to pull off, according to Tony Blair’s housing guru.
title: Blair Housing Guru Warns Labour on 1.5 Million Housebuilding Aim

description: Brigitte Bierlein, who emphasized equality after becoming Austria’s first female chancellor in an interim mandate following the so-called Ibiza scandal that rocked the country’s political elite, has died. She was 74.
title: Brigitte Bierlein, Austria’s First Female Chancellor, Dies at 74

description: Brazil’s government has presented its aid plan for the airline industry to the three largest players in the country with an announcement expected in the second half of the year, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Lula Wants Strings Attached to Brazil’s Rescue Plan for Airlines

description: The United Nations atomic watchdog warned Iran against inflammatory rhetoric after some politicians in the country said engineers could quickly militarize its nuclear program if instructed to do so.
title: Iran’s Remarks on Nuclear Arms Seen Flaming Middle East Cauldron

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Debt Dread: Harsh Budget Realities Loom Over Economic Pledges

description: Giancarlo Giorgetti’s future as Italian finance minister is at the center of mounting speculation in Rome about a prospective post-election reshuffle of Premier Giorgia Meloni’s coalition.
title: Italy’s Giorgetti Is in Frame as Meloni Reset Speculation Mounts

description: Keir Starmer’s Labour Party retains a 22-point lead over Rishi Sunak’s incumbent Conservative Party, as the two leaders gear up for a televised debate on Tuesday — the first of the UK general election campaign.
title: Tories Fail to Dent Labour Polling Lead in Early UK Campaign

description: A Pakistani court suspended a ten year jail sentence given to former prime minister Imran Khan for violating the nation’s secrecy laws but he is not going to be released.
title: Imran Khan Acquitted in Pakistan’s Secrets Act Case

description: Turkey’s exports to Israel all but ground to a halt in May, after President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s government stopped trade until Gaza receives enough humanitarian aid.
title: Turkish Exports to Israel Plunge 99% After Trade Halted Over War

description: South Africa’s most powerful labor union federation, which is allied with the African National Congress, said any coalition deal struck by the party after its disastrous election performance last week must ensure President Cyril Ramaphosa retain his post and its manifesto pledges are upheld.
title: South African Unions Adamant Ramaphosa Must Retain Presidency

description: Egyptian President Abdel-Fattah El-Sisi ordered Prime Minister Mostafa Madbouly to form a new government, as the North African nation pushes ahead with sweeping economic reforms after securing over $50 billion in aid and investments.
title: Egyptian President El-Sisi Orders Formation of New Government

description: Each day, Bloomberg journalists take you across a selection of towns and cities as they gear up for the big vote.
title: India Exit Polls Forecast Of Modi’s Win Rallies Markets, Riles Opposition

description: Saudi Arabia closed the fewest number of first-quarter investment deals since 2021 in a further sign the kingdom is struggling to attract funding from private companies and foreign investors.
title: Saudi Arabia First-Quarter Deal Flow Slumps to Three-Year Low

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Mexico’s Sheinbaum Contends With AMLO’s Legacy

description: A low-profile government agency’s findings on immigration have thrust it into the center of a hotly divisive political debate.
title: The Budget Geeks Who Helped Solve an American Economic Puzzle

description: US Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin travels to Cambodia Tuesday in a push to reset ties with China’s most ardent ally in Southeast Asia amid simmering tensions over the regime’s expanding security and economic ties with Beijing.
title: Pentagon Chief Heads to Cambodia to Renew Ties With China Ally

description: German Economy Minister Robert Habeck said he hopes more interest-rate cuts will follow after the European Central Bank begins its widely anticipated monetary easing cycle this week.
title: German Minister Expects ECB Rate Cut Soon, Hopes More Follow

description: South Korea will suspend a 2018 agreement with North Korea aimed at reducing military tensions after Pyongyang sent nearly 1,000 trash-filled balloons across the border in what it called a campaign against “human scum.”
title: South Korea to Halt Border Deal with North After It Sends Trash-Filled Balloons

description: Russia is seeking to take over uranium assets in Niger held by a state-controlled French company, according to people informed about the matter, in a further challenge to Western interests in Africa.
title: Russia Said to Seek Takeover of France’s Uranium Assets in Niger

description: South African Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana said the African National Congress won’t be “reckless” in choosing a coalition partner after losing its parliamentary majority.
title: South Africa Finance Chief Says ANC to Avoid Reckless Coalition

description: Indian opposition leaders dismissed the exit polls predicting a landslide victory for Prime Minister Narendra Modi, with a top politician calling it a “Modi media poll.”
title: Indian Opposition Leaders Reject Exit Polls Predicting Modi Win

description: Investors braced for further upheaval in South Africa’s financial markets in the wake of last week’s elections that produced no outright winner, with the outcome of ongoing coalition talks remaining highly uncertain.
title: South Africa’s Post-Election Wrangling Leaves Investors in Limbo

description: Shares of Indian state-run companies and infrastructure-related firms are standing out as exit polls predict a landslide victory for Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s ruling party.
title: Infra, State Firms Big Winners as India Exit Polls Show Modi Win

description: China lifted a cap on foreign securities investment for the first time since July, in a move that may help satisfy some of the surging demand for overseas assets even as Beijing seeks to bolster domestic markets.
title: China Raises Limit on Overseas Investment After 10-Month Pause

description: JAKARTA, Indonesia (AP) — One of Thailand's most wanted fugitives will be escorted home on a Thai air force plane after being arrested on Indonesia’s tourist island of Bali following months on the run in connection with several killings and drug trafficking charges in his homeland, officials said Monday.
title: Indonesia to Deport Fugitive to Thailand Wanted on Murder, Drug Trafficking Charges

description: The latest eruption of unrest in New Caledonia bodes ill for the French president’s efforts to retain, and expand, France’s global influence.
title: A Pacific Island in Flames Cuts Macron’s Global Ambition Down to Size

description: Since 2010, Britain has fallen further behind its peers.
title: The UK Has a Productivity Problem. Tory Rule Made It Worse.

description: By slowing sales of gilts at a loss, the central bank would be taking pressure off the treasury.
title: The BOE Could Give Starmer Some Fiscal Elbow Room

description: The Tories aren't entirely to blame for the dire state of the NHS, but the party missed big opportunities to make it better.
title: Britons Have Good Reason to Lose Faith in the NHS

description: A wave of Chinese banks, asset managers and hedge funds are ramping up in the Middle East, jostling with Wall Street firms who are making their own expansion push in a region flush with oil wealth.
title: Chinese Firms Jostle With US Peers for Sliver of Gulf Oil Riches

description: This week’s interest-rate cut is a milestone for the European Central Bank.
title: ECB Rate Cut Will Be Rare Bright Spot in Troubled Euro Region

description: Sandwiched between the world’s great global powers in a time of deepening global tensions, Greek shipowners are still finding a way to thrive.
title: Swirling Global Uncertainties Make It a Great Time to Be a Greek Shipowner

description: After sending nearly 1,000 trash-filled balloons across the border, North Korea has said it’s ready to halt its campaign against the “human scum” in South Korea — as long as they stop sending over balloons filled with leaflets criticizing Pyongyang. While North Korea has offered a possible stop for now, the balloons are almost certain to fly again. Activists in South Korea and Pyongyang’s leaders have flown tens of thousands of balloons across the border for decades to score political points and
title: Why North Korea Is Sending Trash-Filled Balloons Into South Korea: QuickTake

description: For the full experience visit: India Election Results 2024
title: India Election Results 2024

description: Claudia Sheinbaum is on track to become Mexico’s first female leader in a landslide victory, capitalizing on outgoing President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador’s popularity while also inheriting rampant criminal violence and a large fiscal deficit left by his government.
title: Sheinbaum Set to Become Mexico’s First Female President

description: Mexicans trying to vote from abroad in Sunday’s historic election reported long delays — and in some cases were turned away before being able to cast ballots.
title: Mexicans Voting Abroad Face Delays, Denials in Historic Election

description: China said a couple who worked in the central government were caught spying for the UK, escalating a dispute between the two nations over espionage allegations.
title: China Says Couple Working in Central Government Spied for UK

description: China’s leaders are “bizarrely unwilling” to use more government spending to support consumer demand instead of production, according to Nobel laureate in economics Paul Krugman.
title: Krugman Says China Is ‘Bizarrely Unwilling’ to Boost Demand

description: China accused the European Union of working to “suppress” Chinese companies and said it will take action to safeguard its interests, as the bloc moves closer to imposing tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles.
title: China Steps Up Warning to EU Days Before Tariff Decision

description: Voters wait in line at a polling station during the sixth phase of voting for national elections in Delhi, India, on Saturday, May 25, 2024. Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi said his Bharatiya Janata Party has already won a majority of the seats contested in the parliamentary elections due to end next week, putting him in a position to return to office for a third term.
title: Adani Leads Indian Stock Surge as Polls Signal Modi Win
